Don't edit this page, just click on the version number! --> | programming language = [[C++]] | operating system = [[Microsoft Windows]] | language = [http://notepad-plus.sourceforge.net/uk/download.php#Language_files Multilingual (49)] | genre = [[Source code editor]] | license = [[GNU General Public License]] | website = [http://www.notepad-plus-plus.org/ www.notepad-plus-plus.org] }} '''Notepad++''' is a [[text editor]] and [[source code editor]] for [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]]. One advantage of Notepad++ over the built-in Windows text editor, [[Notepad (Windows)|Notepad]], is [[Tab (GUI)|tabbed editing]], which allows working with multiple open files.
Notepad++ is distributed as [[free software]]. The project is hosted on [[SourceForge.net]], from where it has been downloaded over 27 million times<ref>{{cite web | title = SourceForge.net: Project Statistics for Notepad++ | publisher = [[SourceForge.net]] | url = http://sourceforge.net/project/stats/detail.php?group_id=95717&ugn=notepad-plus&type=prdownload&mode=alltime&package_id=0| accessdate =2011-04-18}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://sourceforge.net/top/topalltime.php?type=downloads |title= Top Downloads - For all time, updated daily |accessdate= 2011-04-18 |publisher= [[SourceForge]] }}</ref> and twice won the SourceForge Community Choice Award for Best Developer Tool.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://sourceforge.net/community/cca09/winners/ |title= SourceForge's 4th Annual Community Choice Awards |accessdate= 2009-10-01 |publisher= [[SourceForge]] }}</ref> To display and edit text and programming language [[source code]] files, Notepad++ uses the [[Scintilla (editing component)|Scintilla editor component]].
== Features == General features include:<ref name="Homepage" /> * [[Tabbed document interface]]<ref> {{cite news |url= http://www.appscout.com/2008/07/notepad_does_it_again_again.php |accessdate= 2009-10-01 |title= Notepad++ Does It Again Again |first= Geoff |last= Fox |date= July 7, 2008 |work= AppScout |publisher= [[Ziff Davis Media]] }}</ref> * [[Drag-and-drop]] * [[Clipboard_%28software%29#Clipboard_management|Multiple clipboards]] (plugin required) * [[split screen (computer graphics)|Split screen]] editing and synchronized scrolling * [[Spell checker]] (requires [[GNU Aspell|Aspell]]) (Spell checker does not distinguish between text and code) * Supports text encoding formats such as [[Unicode]], for international [[writing systems]] * Find and replace over multiple documents * [[File comparison]] * [[page zooming|Zooming]]
== Programming languages == [[Image:Npp on mac.jpg|thumb|300px|Running under [[Mac OS X]] using the [[Wine (software)|Wine]] compatibility layer.]]
Source code editing features include:<ref name="Homepage" /> * [[Auto-completion]] * Bookmarks * [[Syntax highlighting]] and [[Folding editor|syntax folding]] * Brace and indent highlighting * [[Regular expression]] find and replace * [[Speech synthesis]] * [[FTP|FTP Browser]] (plug-in included in standard installation) * [[Macro (computer science)|Macro]] recording and execution. * Various tools such as line sorting, text encoding conversion, [[text folding]] * File status auto-detection * [[Plug-in (computing)|Plugins]] for multiline [[regular expression]] search and replace
Notepad++ supports [[syntax highlighting]] and [[Folding editor|syntax folding]] for 52 programming, scripting, and markup languages.<ref name="Homepage">[http://notepad-plus.sourceforge.net/uk/about.php Notepad++ Homepage - "Syntax Highlighting and Syntax Folding"]</ref><ref> {{cite web |url= http://www.techspot.com/news/34846-Download-of-the-Week-Notepad.html |title= Download of the Week: Notepad++ |date= May 26, 2009 |accessdate= 2009-10-01 |first= Matthew |last= DeCarlo |publisher= [[TechSpot]] }}</ref> It attempts to automatically detect the language that a given file uses, using a modifiable list of file extension bindings. Users may also manually set the current language, overriding the extension's default language. The program also supports [[Autocompletion#In_source_code_editors|autocompletion]] for a subset of the API of some programming languages.
The following languages are natively supported by Notepad++ as of version 5.9.2: <!-- ActionScript, Ada, asp, Assembly, autoIt, bash, Batch, C, C++, C#, Caml, CMakeFile, Cobol, CSS, D, DIFF, Flash ActionScript, Fortran, Gui4CLI, Haskell, HTML, ini file, InnoSetup, Java, Javascript, JSP, KiXtart, LISP, Lua, Makefile, Matlab, NSIS, Objective-C, Pascal, Perl, PHP, PowerShell, Postscript, Properties file, Python, R and VHDL. --> {| class="wikitable" style="width:1000px;" ! colspan=18 |Supported Languages |- | [[ActionScript]] | [[Ada (programming language)|Ada]] | [[Active Server Pages|asp]] | Assembly | [[autoIt]] | [[Bash (Unix shell)|bash]] | [[Batch file|Batch]] | [[C (programming language)|C]] |[[C++]] |[[C Sharp (programming language)|C#]] |[[Caml]] |CMakeFile |[[COBOL]] |[[CSS]] |[[D (programming language)|D]] |[[Diff|DIFF]] |-- |[[ActionScript|Flash ActionScript]] |[[Fortran]] |Gui4CLI |[[Haskell (programming language)|Haskell]] |[[HTML]] |[[INI file|ini file]] |[[InnoSetup]] |[[Java (programming language)|Java]] |[[Javascript]] |[[JavaServer Pages|JSP]] |[[KiXtart]] |[[LISP]] |[[Lua (programming language)|Lua]] |[[Makefile]] |[[Matlab]] |[[NSIS]] |-- |[[Objective-C]] |[[Pascal (programming language)|Pascal]] |[[Perl]] |[[PHP]] |[[PowerShell]] |[[Postscript]] |Properties file |[[Python (programming language)|Python]] |[[R (programming language)|R]] |[[VHDL]] | | | | | | |}
Users can also define their own language (for syntax highlighting) and its respective API (for autocompletion) by using the built-in User Language Define System.<ref name="Homepage" /> Users may configure the syntax highlighting's font styles per element, per language, and the resulting formatted script may be [[Inkjet printer|printed]] in full-color ([[WYSIWYG]]). Additionally, Notepad++ displays [[Indent style|indent guidelines]] when source code is indented with [[Tab key|tab characters]], and highlights [[Curly bracket programming language|closing braces, brackets]] and [[Well-formed element|tags]].<!-- note: the languages provided on the homepage do not match the languages supported in the program. There is no such thing as syntax highlighting for ASCII art.-->
== Plugins == Notepad++ has support for [[Macro (computer science)|macros]] and [[Plug-in (computing)|plugins]].<ref> {{cite web |url= http://www.computeractive.co.uk/computeractive/downloads/2196837/notepad |title= Notepad++ 5.5 |date= September 21, 2009 |accessdate= 2009-10-01 |first= Tim |last= Smith |publisher= [[Computeractive]] }}</ref> Currently, there are 27 official plugins for Notepad++, 10 of which are included by default in the program.<ref name="download">[http://notepad-plus.sourceforge.net/uk/download.php Notepad++ Download Page]</ref> The first plugin to be included in the program was ''"TextFX"'', which includes features such as W3C validation for HTML and CSS, text sorting, character case alteration and quote handling.<ref name="textfx">[http://textfx.no-ip.com/textfx/ TextFX Official Homepage]</ref>
== Development == This project, based on the [[Scintilla (editing component)|Scintilla editor component]], is written in [[C++]] with only [[Win32]] [[API]] calls using only the [[Standard Template Library|STL]] in order to increase performance and reduce program size. The aim of Notepad++ is to reduce overall power consumption by using efficient binaries that require less [[Central processing unit|CPU]] power.<ref name="Homepage"/>
==Banned countries and controversy== In March 2008, the "Boycott Beijing 2008" banner was placed on Notepad++'s SourceForge.net homepage.<ref>{{Wayback|url=http://notepad-plus.sourceforge.net/uk/site.htm|title=Notepad++ homepage|date=20080326203742}}</ref> A few months later, most users in China were unable to reach the SourceForge.net website for about a month (June 26, 2008 â July 24, 2008). This led to widespread belief that China had banned SourceForge.net in retaliation for the Boycott banner. <ref name="moonblog">[http://www.moon-blog.com/2008/06/sourceforge-blocked-in-china.html SourceForge Blocked In China]. Moonlight Blog. June 26, 2008.</ref><ref>[http://www.moon-blog.com/2008/07/sourceforge-unblocked-in-china.html SourceForge Unblocked in China]. Moonlight Blog. July 24, 2008.</ref><ref>[http://www.gamedev.net/community/forums/topic.asp?topic_id=500647 Gamedev.net]</ref>
In January 2010, the US government forced open source project hosts to comply with US law and deny access from 5 countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, and Syria). As a response to what the developer felt was a violation of the [[Free and open source software|Free and Open Source Software (FOSS)]] philosophy, in June 2010, Notepad++ moved out of US territorial jurisdiction by releasing a version on [[TuxFamily]], in France.<ref>[http://notepad-plus-plus.org/content/notepad-new-site-notepad-plus-plus-org notepad-plus-plus.org news - Notepad++ new site: notepad-plus-plus.org]</ref><ref>[http://notepad-plus-plus.org/content/release57-outside-the-USA notepad-plus-plus.org news - Notepad++ 5.7 release (outside the USA)]</ref>
